description: From Middle English mouten, from Old English *mutian (cf. bemutian), from Latin mūtō, mūtāre. Doublet of mute.

entries.meaning: The process of shedding or losing a covering of fur, feathers or skin etc.
examples: Some birds change colour during their winter moult.

entries.meaning: The skin or feathers cast off during the process of moulting.

verbs.description: moult (third-person singular simple present moults, present participle moulting, simple past and past participle moulted)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To shed or lose a covering of hair or fur, feathers, skin, horns, etc, and replace it with a fresh one.
(transitive) To shed in such a manner.
